ants-yelling.title: A colony of ants yelling as loud as they possibly can
ants-yelling.desc: Yelling ants are represented by the word “AH” contained in <div> tags in the HTML. The JavaScript uses a setInterval loop that runs every 500 milliseconds. Each time that loop runs, a random ant is selected and set to a large font size. Shortly thereafter, the font size is set back to its original tiny size. CSS is mainly used to center and equally space everything with flexbox.

gentle-giant.title: A gentle giant asking for directions to the local bowling alley
gentle-giant.desc: The giant’s bellowing, gentle voice is represented by huge text with a transparent fill color and super thin outline.

panic-button.title: A panic button for someone in dire need of useless entertainment
panic-button.desc: When the button is pressed, the JavaScript combines three letters at random and opens up a new website. To make the website open properly, it has to add “http://” and “.com” to the three-letter combination. This happens in a loop that runs 10 times.

precious-gem.title: The most precious gem in the entire world, in the palm of your hands
precious-gem.desc: This code uses p5.js to create a whole bunch of triangles. Each triangle has two corners that move across the edges of the screen. The third corner is where the mouse cursor is. All of these triangles are drawn using the “DIFFERENCE” blend mode so that intersections go from white to black, or black to white.

perfect-hue.title: In search of the perfect color for a perfectionist’s living room rug
perfect-hue.desc: This code uses p5.js to create a whole bunch of triangles. Each triangle has two corners that move across the edges of the screen. The third corner is where the mouse cursor is. All of these triangles are drawn using the “DIFFERENCE” blend mode so that intersections go from white to black, or black to white.

banana-dealer.title: Desperate for bananas, low on cash, stuck in a volatile economy
banana-dealer.desc: A loop sets a new cost for bananas every 250ms. When the purchase button is clicked, a function checks if the current banana cost is less than how much money is left. If there’s enough money, a banana is purchased.

accidental-explosions.title: Someone keeps launching missles by accident, and that person might be you
accidental-explosions.desc: Every time you move the mouse, a function generates a new circle that uses a CSS animation to expand.

dance-audition.title: You’re up on the world’s #1 hit amateur dance show
dance-audition.desc: Every time you move the mouse, a function generates a new circle that uses a CSS animation to expand.
